page.title: 06Mayne Farm.
page.content: Mayne Farm has about 1500 to 1600 acres of land. There are 9 workers on the farm. The owner of the farm, Mr Anderson, inherited the farm from his father. The farm has 2 holstein bulls and 270 grey face cows. Each cow produces about 6 gallons of milk per day. Normally a cow has one calf each year which is taken after the first week but the cow continues giving milk for the next 300 days. Two months before the cow has another calf it dries up. The farm also has a lot of sheep and three collie sheep dogs. They own 12 tractors and 1 combine harvester. The ground is medium sandy and it is good for growing crops. Mayne Farm is a very nice farm to visit and sometimes we go for barbeques with the Guides.
